item.title: 'Roads Like Priyanka Gandhi's Cheeks': BJP Leader Bidhuri's Remark Draws Congress Ire - News18
item.description:
BJP Leader Ramesh Bidhuri's Comment About Priyanka Gandhi Sparks Outrage

Date: January 05, 2025, Source: News18

A political stir erupted after BJP’s Ramesh Bidhuri made an inappropriate comment regarding Priyanka Gandhi, stating that future roads will be like her cheeks if his party wins.

  • The remark drew immediate backlash from Congress, which announced plans to file an FIR against Bidhuri.
  • Delhi BJP chief Virendraa Sachdeva advised leaders to refrain from making derogatory remarks about women.
  • In his defense, Bidhuri later expressed regret and retracted his statement.
  • Congress labeled the BJP as anti-women and demanded accountability from its leadership.
“If anyone is hurt by my remark, I express regret over it and I take my words back…” - Ramesh Bidhuri

The incident reflects ongoing tensions and challenges in political discourse regarding gender sensitivity.

item.title: PM inaugurates Delhi section of RRTS; Meerut to be accessible in 40 minutes - The Hindu
item.description:
PM inaugurates Delhi section of RRTS; Meerut to be accessible in 40 minutes

Date & Source: January 05, 2025 - The Hindu

Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated a 13-km-long section of the Rapid Rail Transit System (RRTS) on January 5, 2025, connecting Delhi and Meerut, significantly reducing travel time for commuters.

  • The section is between New Ashok Nagar in Delhi and Sahibabad in Uttar Pradesh.
  • Travel time from New Ashok Nagar to Meerut South is now under 40 minutes.
  • Train service frequency is set at 15 minutes starting from 5 p.m. on inauguration day.
  • The fare from New Ashok Nagar to Meerut South is ₹150 for standard and ₹225 for premium coaches.
  • Foundation stone for the project was laid by Modi in March 2019.
“This project is a ₹30,000-crore initiative that will enhance connectivity.”

The inauguration of this section marks a significant advancement in Delhi's transportation infrastructure, promoting ease of travel between the capital and Meerut.

item.title: 'Take my words back': BJP's Bidhuri first defends, then 'regrets' Priyanka comment - The Times of India
item.description:
'Take my words back': BJP's Bidhuri first defends, then 'regrets' Priyanka comment

Publication Date: [Date not provided] | Source: [Source not provided]

In a controversial statement, BJP's Bidhuri initially defended his comments regarding Priyanka but later expressed regret, leading to public debates about accountability in political discourse.

  • Bidhuri's comments sparked immediate backlash.
  • His later regret attempts to mitigate the public's response.
  • This incident highlights ongoing tensions within Indian politics.
Bidhuri stated, "I take my words back" as he faced criticism.

This situation raises questions about the responsibility of public figures in their statements.

item.title: Two arrested, Hyderabad college principal among 7 booked after female students accuse staff of filming in - The Times of India
item.description:
Two Arrested, Hyderabad College Principal Among 7 Booked After Female Students Accuse Staff of Filming in Washrooms

Publication Date: Recent
Source: Various News Outlets

After serious allegations from female students about staff filming in washrooms, two individuals have been arrested, including the college principal.

  • The incident involves accusations of staff members secretly filming female students.
  • Authorities have moved quickly, booking seven individuals connected to the college.
  • Legal actions are being taken in response to the breaches of privacy.
  • This has led to protests and demands for accountability from the student body.
“We will not tolerate any infringement of our privacy and will fight for justice,” said a representative from the student union.

This incident calls attention to the need for better safeguarding measures in educational institutions to protect students' rights.

item.title: 'Reflects AAP's commitment': Arvind Kejriwal says projects launched by PM Modi 'joint ventures' of Delhi - The Times of India
item.description:
‘Reflects AAP's commitment’: Arvind Kejriwal says projects launched by PM Modi 'joint ventures' of Delhi government, Centre

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] | Source: Times of India

Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal has remarked that the projects launched by Prime Minister Narendra Modi should be considered as collaborative efforts between the Delhi government and the central government.

  • Kejriwal emphasized the cooperative relationship in executing public projects.
  • The discussion comes in the context of various infrastructure and development initiatives in Delhi.
  • Kejriwal has been advocating for joint projects that serve the public interest.
“These projects are not just initiated by the Centre; they involve our local governance as well,” said Kejriwal.

This stance aims to solidify AAP's role in key initiatives and reflect a positive image of collaboration in governance.

item.title: Arvind Kejriwal hits back at PM Modi: 'These projects wouldn't have been inaugurated if...' - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Kejriwal Responds to Modi's Criticisms Amid RRTS Inauguration

Date: Jan 05, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

In a heated exchange, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal defended his party against Prime Minister Modi's critiques following the inauguration of the Delhi-Meerut RRTS corridor, emphasizing cooperation with the Centre despite ongoing tensions.

  • Kejriwal criticized PM Modi for using most of his speech to attack AAP rather than discussing development.
  • The RRTS corridor inauguration signifies direct connectivity from Meerut to Delhi.
  • Kejriwal claimed AAP's cooperation was vital for the inauguration of infrastructure projects.
  • The political rivalry intensifies as Delhi heads towards assembly elections.
“Today, the PM spoke for 38 minutes and he kept abusing the people of Delhi and the elected government for 29 minutes...” - Arvind Kejriwal

The confrontation highlights the ongoing political tensions as Delhi's assembly elections approach, with both leaders jockeying for public support.

item.title: Former Allahabad HC judge Mukul Jain appointed judicial member of SAT | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Former Allahabad HC judge Mukul Jain appointed judicial member of SAT

Date: 3 January 2024

Source: Live Mint

The Centre has appointed former Allahabad high court judge justice Mayank Kumar Jain as the second judicial member of the Securities Appellate Tribunal (SAT). Jain will serve a term of four years or until he reaches the age of 67, whichever comes first.

SAT, established under the Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) Act, serves as an appellate body for appeals against orders passed by Sebi. The tribunal handles cases related to insider trading, market manipulation, regulatory violations, and other matters under Sebi’s jurisdiction.

  • Justice Jain's appointment was formalized by the ministry of finance.
  • SAT currently operates with a single bench and plans to establish a second bench for timely resolutions.
  • Jain's judicial career began in 1990, and he has held significant positions in various judicial capacities.
“With the addition of Justice Jain, the SAT is expected to establish a second bench to expedite its growing caseload.”

This appointment aims to enhance the efficiency of the SAT amid increasing demand for its services in the securities market.

item.title: US Influencer Shares Her Biggest Struggle With Dinner Traditions In India - News18
item.description:
US Influencer Shares Her Biggest Struggle With Dinner Traditions In India

Date: January 05, 2025

Source: News18

American influencer Kristen Fischer highlights the cultural differences in dining traditions between India and the United States, particularly how meals signal the end of socializing in India compared to the US.

  • Fischer has been living in New Delhi since 2011.
  • In the US, food is served immediately upon guest arrival, while in India, meals are served later in the evening.
  • Fischer struggles with being hungry while waiting for meals when visiting friends.
  • She notes the cultural expectation to socialize before eating in India is a significant challenge for her.
  • Fischer reflects on experiences where dinner is served late, often after 11 PM.
“This was, and still is, the hardest cultural difference for me coming to India.” - Kristen Fischer

The cultural differences in dining traditions highlight the challenges faced by those adapting to new cultural norms while living abroad.

item.title: Delhi Assembly elections 2025: Prime Minister Narendra Modi addresses parivartan rally in Rohini in New Delhi - The Hindu
item.description:
Delhi Assembly elections 2025: Prime Minister Narendra Modi addresses parivartan rally in Rohini in New Delhi

Date: January 5, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

Prime Minister Narendra Modi addressed a rally in Rohini, New Delhi, highlighting the achievements of the BJP and inviting voters to reject the ruling AAP government in the upcoming assembly elections.

  • Inauguration of the Janakpuri West-Krishna Park Extension section of Delhi Metro’s Phase IV.
  • Foundation stone laid for the 26.5 km Rithala-Kundli corridor, enhancing connectivity.
  • Modi criticized the AAP government for mismanagement and promised no welfare schemes would be cut under BJP.
  • Emphasized the need for change in governance to improve Delhi's infrastructure.
“Only when this ‘aapda (disaster)’ is gotten rid of in Delhi, the double-engine of development will come.” - Prime Minister Narendra Modi

Modi’s rally sought to generate support for the BJP by focusing on past grievances under AAP, presenting the BJP as a catalyst for positive change in Delhi.

item.title: Delhi Assembly elections 2025: Prime Minister Narendra Modi addresses parivartan rally in rohini in new delhi - The Hindu
item.description:
Delhi Assembly elections 2025: Prime Minister Narendra Modi addresses parivartan rally in Rohini in New Delhi

Date: January 5, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

Prime Minister Narendra Modi addressed a rally in Rohini, New Delhi, highlighting the achievements of the BJP and inviting voters to reject the ruling AAP government in the upcoming assembly elections.

  • Inauguration of the Janakpuri West-Krishna Park Extension section of Delhi Metro’s Phase IV.
  • Foundation stone laid for the 26.5 km Rithala-Kundli corridor, enhancing connectivity.
  • Modi criticized the AAP government for mismanagement and promised no welfare schemes would be cut under BJP.
  • Emphasized the need for change in governance to improve Delhi's infrastructure.
“Only when this ‘aapda (disaster)’ is gotten rid of in Delhi, the double-engine of development will come.” - Prime Minister Narendra Modi

Modi’s rally sought to generate support for the BJP by focusing on past grievances under AAP, presenting the BJP as a catalyst for positive change in Delhi.

item.title: PM Modi cites The Indian Express report, slams AAP over money spent on ‘Sheesh Mahal’ - The Indian Express
item.description:
PM Modi cites The Indian Express report, slams AAP over money spent on ‘Sheesh Mahal’

Date: January 5, 2025

Source: The Indian Express

Prime Minister Narendra Modi criticized the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) for its expenses on the Sheesh Mahal, using a report from The Indian Express to highlight allegations of corruption during a recent rally.

  • PM Modi referred to The Indian Express report based on a CAG report about the Sheesh Mahal expenses.
  • AAP reportedly spent Rs 33.66 crore on renovations for Kejriwal's office during the COVID-19 pandemic.
  • Modi stated that AAP's focus was on the Sheesh Mahal instead of aiding citizens during the pandemic.
  • He remarked that he could have also built a Sheesh Mahal but chose to prioritize housing projects for citizens.
“You will be pained to know that when people were fighting Covid, when they were running around to get medicines and oxygen, their (AAP’s) entire focus was on making Sheesh Mahal.”

Modi's remarks underline a broader political strategy as Delhi elections approach, emphasizing accountability and responsibility in governance.

item.title: Delhi News Live Updates: Citing CAG report accessed by The Indian Express, PM Modi slams Kejriwal over money spent on ‘Sheesh Mahal’ - The Indian Express
item.description:
Delhi News Live Updates: Citing CAG report accessed by The Indian Express, PM Modi slams Kejriwal over money spent on ‘Sheesh Mahal’

Date & Source: Published by The Indian Express

In a recent rally, Prime Minister Narendra Modi criticized Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal for excessive spending on the renovation of his official residence, highlighting a report by the Comptroller and Auditor General (CAG).

  • Modi pointed out that Rs 33.66 crore was spent on renovations initially budgeted at Rs 7.91 crore.
  • This included Rs 96 lakh on curtains and Rs 39 lakh on kitchen equipment.
  • Modi also inaugurated a new 13-km section of the Delhi-Meerut RRTS corridor during the event.
  • The BJP has announced its first list of candidates for the upcoming elections targeting Kejriwal and his party.
“The party only focused on 'Sheesh Mahal',” Modi stated, referencing the lavish spending.

The criticism highlights ongoing political tensions in Delhi as elections approach, with the BJP positioning itself against the AAP's governance.

item.title: PM Modi inaugurates Krishna Park Extension: All you need to know about first section of Delhi Metro Phase 4 - Hindustan Times
item.description:
PM Modi Inaugurates Krishna Park Extension: First Section of Delhi Metro Phase 4

Publication Date: Jan 05, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated the Janakpuri West-Krishna Park Extension section, marking the opening of the first segment of the Delhi Metro Rail Corporation’s (DMRC) Phase 4.

  • PM Modi inaugurated the Janakpuri West-Krishna Park Extension stretch, the first section of the Delhi Metro Phase 4 today.
  • Passenger services will commence on the section on the Magenta Line from 3 pm Sunday.
  • The services between Janakpuri West and Krishna Park Extension will be available at a frequency of 16 minutes initially to ensure a smooth scaling up.
  • After the Janakpuri West and Krishna Park Extension addition, the Magenta Line will now become about 40 kilometres long.
  • The rest of the Magenta Line extension from Krishna Park Extension to RK Ashram Marg will be completed in phases by 2026.
  • The first Metro train, consisting of six coaches, procured by Delhi Metro for its Phase-4 operations, arrived in November last year.
  • The Janakpuri West-R K Ashram Marg extension of the Magenta Line will receive 144 new coaches (24 trains), ANI reported.
  • The section will include a single new station, Krishna Park Extension, extending the operational Magenta Line from Botanical Garden metro station to Janakpuri West.
  • PM Modi will also lay the foundation stone for the 26.5-kilometre Rithala-Narela-Kundli (Sonipat) Metro corridor under Phase 4.

item.title: PM Modi in Delhi live updates: ‘Let’s get rid of AAP-da’ says PM Modi in Rohini rally - Hindustan Times
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: ‘Disgusting mentality’: Congress reacts to Ramesh Bidhuri's 'cheeks' remark for Priyanka Gandhi - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Congress Condemns Ramesh Bidhuri's Controversial Remark about Priyanka Gandhi

Publication Date: Jan 05, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The article discusses Congress leader Supriya Srinate's reaction to Ramesh Bidhuri's controversial comment about Priyanka Gandhi, criticizing it as a reflection of an anti-women mentality within the BJP.

  • Ramesh Bidhuri made a sexist remark comparing the smoothness of roads to Priyanka Gandhi's cheeks.
  • Supriya Srinate condemned the statement, calling it reflective of a disgusting mentality towards women.
  • Bidhuri defended himself by comparing his comment to a past remark by Lalu Prasad Yadav regarding Hema Malini.
  • The BJP has officially nominated Bidhuri as a candidate for the Kalkaji assembly constituency.
“BJP is extremely anti-women. Ramesh Bidhuri's statement regarding Priyanka Gandhi is not only shameful but also shows his disgusting mentality towards women.” - Supriya Srinate

The controversy adds to the ongoing discussions about the treatment of women in politics, especially regarding comments made by male politicians.

item.title: Unmarried couples no longer welcome in this city, OYO changes check-in rules - The Times of India
item.description:
OYO Alters Check-In Rules for Unmarried Couples

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

OYO has announced new check-in policies that prohibit unmarried couples from staying together in their hotels, a decision that has sparked significant public debate regarding personal freedoms and business practices.

  • The decision aims to address concerns related to safety and the company's reputation.
  • New policies have been implemented across major cities where OYO operates.
  • Public backlash and conversations about the implications for personal privacy and freedom are ongoing.
  • This shift in policy may influence the travel habits of young couples looking for affordable accommodations.
“This policy is not just a business decision; it reflects societal norms and pressures.”

In conclusion, OYO's decision to change their check-in rules may have far-reaching impacts not only on the company but also on the broader societal attitudes towards unmarried couples.

item.title: several killed as Advanced Light Helicopter of the indian coast guard crashes in Gujarat's Porbandar - The Hindu
item.description:
Indian Coast Guard Helicopter Crash in Gujarat Claims Three Lives

Date: January 05, 2025

Source: The Hindu

A Dhruv Advanced Light Helicopter (ALH)-MkIII of the Indian Coast Guard crashed at Porbandar airport during a routine training sortie, resulting in the deaths of three personnel.

  • The helicopter CG859 crashed at about 12:15 p.m. on Sunday.
  • The crash involved two pilots and one aircrew diver.
  • Immediate recovery efforts were made, but all crew members were declared dead upon arrival at the hospital.
  • A Board of Inquiry has been initiated to investigate the reasons for the crash.
“Immediately post incident, the crew were recovered and shifted to Government Hospital Porbandar, where they were declared brought dead.”

The service will honor the fallen crew with traditional cremation rites.

item.title: Delhi to Meerut South in 40 minutes: All about the Namo Bharat RRTS corridor inaugurated by PM Modi - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Delhi to Meerut in 40 Minutes: Namo Bharat RRTS Corridor Inaugurated by PM Modi

Date: Jan 05, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

On January 5, 2025, Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated a 13-km section of the Delhi-Meerut Regional Rapid Transit System (RRTS) corridor, significantly reducing travel time between Delhi and Meerut.

  • The RRTS corridor connects Sahibabad in Uttar Pradesh to New Ashok Nagar in Delhi.
  • The full 55-km RRTS corridor includes 11 operational stations.
  • Passenger services are set to commence at 5 PM with trains running every 15 minutes.
  • Fares are ₹150 for standard coach and ₹225 for premium coach.
  • The newly inaugurated section has a 6 km underground stretch, including key interchanges with the Delhi Metro.
  • The project aims to improve regional transit and includes 16 Namo Bharat stations.
“Delhi is now seamlessly connected to Meerut, cutting travel time by a third.”

This inauguration marks a significant expansion of the RRTS network, providing efficient and speedy transport options in the region.

item.title: Coast Guard Chopper Crashes In Gujarat's Porbandar, 3 Dead: Sources - NDTV
item.description:
Coast Guard Chopper Crashes In Gujarat's Porbandar, 3 Dead: Sources

Publication Date: Not provided Source: NDTV

An Advanced Light Helicopter of the Indian Coast Guard crashed in Gujarat's Porbandar, resulting in the deaths of three crew members. The helicopter was on a routine sortie when it caught fire after crashing into an open field.

  • The ALH Dhruv helicopter was reportedly attempting to evacuate an injured person from a motor tanker.
  • The reason for the crash is under investigation.
  • A few individuals on the ground were also injured and are receiving treatment at a local civil hospital.
  • This incident echoes a previous crash in September where three crew members went missing after their helicopter fell into the sea.
  • Following a series of incidents, a safety audit of the ALH Dhruv fleet was conducted, addressing design and metallurgy issues.
“The Indian Coast Guard has a total of over 325 ALH Dhruv helicopters, all of which underwent technical checks.”

This tragic event underscores the ongoing concerns regarding the safety and operational readiness of the helicopter fleet. Further details about the victims and the crash's cause are awaited.

item.title: Coast guard helicopter crashes in Gujarat during training, 3 dead - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Coast guard helicopter crashes in Gujarat during training, 3 dead

Date: Jan 05, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

An Indian Coast Guard Advanced Light Helicopter (ALH) Dhruv crashed during a training sortie in Gujarat's Porbandar, resulting in the death of all three crew members aboard.

  • The helicopter faced technical difficulties before the crash.
  • The incident occurred during a routine training flight at the Coast Guard Air Enclave.
  • All three crew members, including two pilots, were killed.
  • The Coast Guard is currently investigating the incident.
  • This crash follows a recent safety upgrade on the ALH fleet due to prior accidents.
  • The Dhruv fleet has faced safety concerns and had been grounded previously.
"Three crew members were killed in the incident," a police official was quoted as saying.

The Coast Guard's investigation will determine the next steps following this tragic event, which reflects ongoing safety challenges with the helicopter fleet.

item.title: Pani puri vendor receives GST notice for Rs 40 lakh transactions; internet mocks with 'career change' sug - The Times of India
item.description:
Pani puri vendor receives GST notice for Rs 40 lakh transactions; internet mocks with "career change" suggestions

Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

Amid a growing trend of digital transactions among street vendors, a Pani Puri vendor in India has received GST notices for exceeding Rs 40 lakh in annual transactions, causing a stir on social media filled with humorous takes and commentary on small business taxation.

  • Pani Puri vendors traditionally operated informally but are now facing GST notices due to digital transactions.
  • Social media reacts with jokes and memes about Pani Puri vendors becoming corporate giants.
  • The increasing prevalence of digital payment methods like UPI has led to more street vendors crossing the GST threshold.
  • As digital payments rise, the informal economy shrinks, bringing more vendors into the formal tax framework.
“As digital payments expand, small businesses are being drawn into the formal tax system.”

This incident reflects a significant transformation in the Indian small business landscape, highlighting the effects of digitalization and tax compliance on informal vendors.

item.title: Prashant Kishor joins BPSC aspirants' protest, urges Tejashwi to lead the agitation - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Prashant Kishor Joins BPSC Protest, Urges Tejashwi Yadav to Lead

Date: Jan 05, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Prashant Kishor joined students protesting against the Bihar Civil Services (BPSC) exam early Sunday, urging RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav to lead the demonstrations.

  • Kishor expressed solidarity with students demanding the cancellation of the BPSC examination.
  • He encouraged Tejashwi Yadav to take charge of the protests.
  • Kishor stated, “This is not a dharna. This is the passion of the people of Bihar to better their conditions.”
  • Students are calling for the cancellation of the Integrated Combined (Preliminary) Competitive Examination (CCE) 2024 due to alleged question paper leaks.
“He (Tejashwi Yadav) is a tall leader... We care about the agenda of the students,” said Kishor.

Kishor’s involvement highlights the rising tensions surrounding the BPSC exam and the political implications as various leaders weigh in.

item.title: Tamil Nadu CM Stalin announces $1 million prize for deciphering Indus Valley Script - The Hindu
item.description:
Tamil Nadu CM Stalin announces $1 million prize for deciphering Indus Valley Script

Published: January 05, 2025 - Source: The Hindu

Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M.K. Stalin announced a $1 million prize for experts or organizations that succeed in deciphering the scripts of the Indus Valley Civilisation, stated during the centenary of its discovery.

  • The aim is to encourage research into the ancient scripts.
  • A ₹2 crore grant is established for research in honor of noted archaeologist Iravatham Mahadevan.
  • Stalin highlighted the historical connections between symbols found in the Indus Valley and those in Tamil Nadu.
  • He credited John Marshall’s discovery with altering perceptions about Indian civilization.
“His argument that Indus Valley Civilisation predated Aryan Civilization and the language spoken in the Indus Valley could be Dravidian has been strengthened further,” said Chief Minister Stalin.

This initiative aims to revive interest in ancient Tamil culture and its connections to early civilization, possibly reshaping historical narratives on the subject.

item.title: PM Modi inaugurates Delhi-Meerut Namo Bharat RRTS line worth Rs 4,600 crore - Business Standard
item.description:
PM Modi Inaugurates Delhi-Meerut Namo Bharat RRTS Line Worth Rs 4,600 Crore

Published on: Sunday
Source: [Your Source Here]

The Prime Minister inaugurated a 13-km section of the Delhi-Ghaziabad-Meerut Namo Bharat corridor, promising improved connectivity and faster transit times.

This corridor worth Rs 4,600 crore includes significant stations, promising to cut down travel time between cities substantially.

  • The Namo Bharat trains can operate at speeds up to 160 km/h.
  • Travel time between Delhi and Meerut reduced to about one hour.
  • Standard fare from New Ashok Nagar to Meerut South is Rs 150.
  • PM Modi engaged with children during the inaugural ride.
“This inauguration comes weeks ahead of the Delhi Assembly elections.”

The launch of this corridor is part of a larger initiative where PM Modi will inaugurate projects worth Rs 12,200 crore, including expansions of the Delhi Metro.

item.title: Dallewal’s health deteriorates after addressing ‘kisan mahapanchayat’ at Khanauri - The Tribune India
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: HYDRAA demolishes 5-storey illegal building in Ayyappa Society, Madhapur - Deccan Chronicle
item.description:
HYDRAA Demolishes Illegal 5-Storey Building in Ayyappa Society, Madhapur

Publication Date: Sunday
Source: Deccan Chronicle

The Disaster Response Force (DRF) personnel have begun demolishing a 5-storey illegally constructed building at 100 Feet Road in Ayyappa Society, following the Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation's (GHMC) directives and a High Court ruling declaring the structure illegal.

  • HYDRAA's action against illegal constructions continues in Madhapur.
  • The demolition started after inspections by Hydraa Commissioner Ranganath.
  • Power supply to the area was cut off, and police monitored traffic during the operation.
The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) had issued notices to the building's owners last year.

This operation marks a significant step in enforcing building regulations in the city, aiming to curb illegal constructions.

item.title: HYDRAA begins demolition of illegal building in Hyderabad - The Siasat Daily

item.title: OYO changes policy in Meerut, no check-ins for unmarried couples; may extend to more cities - The Times of India
item.description:
OYO Changes Policy in Meerut, No Check-Ins for Unmarried Couples

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

OYO, a major hospitality service provider, has announced a new policy in Meerut that restricts check-ins for unmarried couples, with potential plans to extend this policy to other cities across India.

  • The policy addresses concerns related to safety and local regulations.
  • Customers report mixed reactions, with some fearing discrimination.
  • The company aims to better align with societal norms in certain regions.
  • This move raises questions about privacy and the rights of customers.
“The decision is made to ensure the safety of all guests, but it can feel restrictive on personal freedoms.”

OYO's policy changes may set a precedent for how the hospitality industry navigates cultural sensitivities in India.

item.title: Only married couples allowed: OYO revises guidelines, relationship proof required for check-in | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Only married couples allowed: OYO revises guidelines, relationship proof required for check-in

Publication Date: Sunday | Source: PTI

Hotel booking company OYO has revised its check-in rules, now requiring proof of relationship for couples at partner hotels, starting in Meerut, Uttar Pradesh.

  • Unmarried couples can no longer check in.
  • Valid proof of relationship is mandatory for all bookings.
  • Hotels have discretion to accept or decline bookings.
  • OYO is responding to feedback from civil society groups.
  • Objective is to enhance brand image and improve safety for various traveler groups.
“OYO is committed to upholding safe and responsible hospitality practices... we also recognise our responsibility to listen to and work with the law enforcement and civil society groups.” - Pawas Sharma, OYO Region Head, North India

This policy aims to reflect changing perceptions and enhance safety for all guests.
